thread.title: Meyer Says Picking Starting Quarterback Is A Delicate Decision
thread.title_full: Meyer Says Picking Starting Quarterback Is A Delicate Decision

title: Meyer Says Picking Starting Quarterback Is A Delicate Decision
text:
By 10TV Web Staff Monday October 19, 2015 4:14 PM COLUMBUS, Ohio - 
During his weekly press conference, Ohio State head coach Urban Meyer was asked once again about the starting quarterback position. 
The question has been an on-going debate all season after both J.T. Barrett and Cardale Jones were successful during the 2014 season. 
Jones has been the starter so far this season but Barrett has been involved more and more. 
In Saturday night’s game, Barrett threw for two scores and ran for over 100 yards with two touchdowns on the ground. 
Jones was only 9-15 for 84 yards. 
Meyer said that nothing would be announced Monday because he hasn’t had a chance to sit down with the quarterback to formally review everything. 
“We’re just behind because of the night game…there’s a lot of things going on,” he said. “I have an idea but I want to make sure I visit with everybody and make sure we’re doing the right thing.” 
When asked if the offense was running better with Barrett currently, he replied that it was doing better against Penn State. 
Meyer added that anytime there’s a change at a position it’s a delicate decision especially with the quarterback spot. 
“Someone made the comment ‘Do you really care who plays at quarterback’ the other day and absolutely we care,” he said. “It’s not number 16 and 12, those are people that we care about deeply and we’re not ashamed to say that.” 
The Buckeyes are back on the road this weekend as they will travel to Piscataway, N.J. to face Rutgers Saturday at 8 p.m. ©2015 by 10TV.com. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. Currently in Columbus
